query: Synthesize all references to the 'analytics' Gulfstream developed in 2023.
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: Synthesize all references to the 'analytics' Gulfstream developed in 2023.

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[5. Joe Schuster - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Confirm continued references to June 21 RTS into early May (PHB p. 16; GAC0040486).

[Gulfstream - Prehearing Brief .pdf, p.54]
c 'pre sly references 1his Agreement and is signed by authorized representatives of bo1h parties.

Data analytics files

[Combined_20250505172300.pdf, p.22]
in June of 2023. At that time, the data and analytics described above

[Combined_20250505172300.pdf, p.462]
2023. At that time, the data and analytics described above had not been released and

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Ask if he reviewed Gulfstream’s July 2023 analytics tool or the data behind it.

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Q: You know Gulfstream had access to internal analytics showing typical G550 inspections at St. Louis exceeded 100+ days?

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Q: Are you aware Gulfstream rolled out a new downtime analytics tool in July 2023?

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Gulfstream did not provide an updated or revised Proposal after providing it in June 2023. I later learned that Gulfstream had introduced new data analytics capabilities in July 2023, designed to provide more accurate historical cost and downtime information for major inspections. However, Gulfstream did not use this tool to update our Proposal before we signed it in September 2023, nor before the Aircraft was inputted in January 2024. They failed to provide us with the benefit of this improved data.

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Gulfstream attempted to justify the delays and cost overruns by blaming unexpected corrosion findings and suggesting issues with the Aircraft's maintenance history or storage. I reject these excuses. As stated earlier, the Aircraft was well-maintained by Avcon, based at Farnborough (not a high-corrosion environment), washed regularly, and flown frequently (approx. 700 hours/year). Furthermore, Gulfstream, as the OEM with access to its own historical data and the specific maintenance history of this Aircraft (including the 144-month inspection and July 2023 work), should have anticipated the potential for corrosion and provided a realistic estimate from the outset. Their failure to do so, especially after introducing their new data analytics tool, constitutes a breach of their duty of care.

[2. Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
Should Gulfstream have used its July 2023 data analytics tool to revise or clarify those estimates?
